[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'bep', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2018-06-30 09:28:54+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': 'You can currently set

```bash
type: pretty
layout: two-colums
```

In every content page, list and single pages. Which makes it flexible. But if you take the base layouts into account, it is hard to create a couple of reusable templates that can be applied to new sections on demand (without creating duplicates):

If I set this in `news/_index.md`:

```bash
type: "3-column"
```

Then I want that type to be in the template lookup order (before the most general ones) for both that section and other pages in that section.

This means that if I create `news/article.md` I don't have to do something extra to get that "3-column" layout.

This behaviour matches what we do with the `section` today, but this will make it more flexible.

So we add

* The current section's type if set
* The root section's type if set

In that order.', 'title': "Layout lookup should consider root and current section's type if set", 'type': 'issue'}

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Layout lookup should consider root and current section's type if set
username_0: You can currently set

```bash
type: pretty
layout: two-colums
```

In every content page, list and single pages. Which makes it flexible. But if you take the base layouts into account, it is hard to create a couple of reusable templates that can be applied to new sections on demand (without creating duplicates):

If I set this in `news/_index.md`:

```bash
type: "3-column"
```

Then I want that type to be in the template lookup order (before the most general ones) for both that section and other pages in that section.

This means that if I create `news/article.md` I don't have to do something extra to get that "3-column" layout.

This behaviour matches what we do with the `section` today, but this will make it more flexible.

So we add

* The current section's type if set
* The root section's type if set

In that order.<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_0: I need to reconsider/refine this one, so I'll reopen to remind me.
<issue_comment>username_0: You can currently set

```bash
type: pretty
layout: two-colums
```

In every content page, list and single pages. Which makes it flexible. But if you take the base layouts into account, it is hard to create a couple of reusable templates that can be applied to new sections on demand (without creating duplicates):

If I set this in `news/_index.md`:

```bash
type: "3-column"
```

Then I want that type to be in the template lookup order (before the most general ones) for both that section and other pages in that section.

This means that if I create `news/article.md` I don't have to do something extra to get that "3-column" layout.

This behaviour matches what we do with the `section` today, but this will make it more flexible.

So we add

* The current section's type if set
* The root section's type if set

In that order.
<issue_comment>username_0: I have enabled this for page + section right now. Will have to think about this a little bit. Testing it and it wasn't that powerful as I hoped -- but that is because of the baseof resolution. I will create another issue for that. 

Note to self: For taxonomies, make sure this does not resolve to list.html in the type override folder.
<issue_comment>username_1: There is one related commit to this issue that doesn't show up here.

This is the one about `.FirstSection`: https://github.com/gohugoio/hugo/commit/c790029e1dbb0b66af18d05764bd6045deb2e180

Cross posting this from the forum, because this link needs to be here also.

As requested by https://twitter.com/kwuchu/status/1267438396340932610', 'title': 'statement to express community solidarity', 'type': 'issue'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'kategengler', 'comment_id': 637041058.0, 'datetime': '2020-06-01 18:51:31+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'My only concern is that (from reviewing Percy) this also takes down the Community Guidelines that is linked to from many places and feels important to be available for review.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'kategengler', 'comment_id': 637045497.0, 'datetime': '2020-06-01 19:01:47+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_1', 'text': 'To clarify, my concern is not linking to the guidelines from the message, but ensuring the URL for the guidelines http://emberjs.com/guidelines still has them available to peruse.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'tomdale', 'comment_id': 637081573.0, 'datetime': '2020-06-01 20:21:26+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_2', 'text': 'I am in favor of this change.

I was happy to see Ember used at the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic to quickly roll out a global tracking dashboard, and I hope Ember will similarly be used now in the pursuit of justice.  I believe this PR strikes the right balance of making a bold statement while keeping learning content available for people building applications to hold the powerful accountable.

Second, we serve an international audience and the U.S. does not have a monopoly on injustice. We should use this opportunity to start defining a set of rules for when and how we make these kinds of statements, to avoid sending the signal that only American pain matters.

But that discussion feels too academic to have right at this moment, when my Black brothers and sisters are being murdered by militarized police who are never held accountable for their actions. As small of a gesture this is, I want them to know that we are united in their struggle and that Black Lives Matter.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'wycats', 'comment_id': 637082761.0, 'datetime': '2020-06-01 20:23:52+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_3', 'text': 'This looks good to me.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}
 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'sandstrom', 'comment_id': 641772017.0, 'datetime': '2020-06-10 06:57:52+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_4', 'text': "Not against the message, but I'm curious why this issue is singled out. I think you (the US) has a pretty flawed justice system[1][2][3][4] and these flaws has been known for a long time. But it's not just you. 

For example, the Philippine police has been on a fairly well-documented killing spree[5][6][7] during the past few years, in a country where police is killing about ~10x as many per year compared to the US.

Again, I'm not against open-source projects taking a stance. Though personally, I think it would be better to focus on issues closer to the software field, e.g. software patents and government efforts to weaken encryption.

Obviously there is a ton of social and economical injustices that one could get involved in. However, your flawed justice system is actually pretty functional compared to some other places. So if you want to be non-discriminatory in what causes you support, up next should be a 10x longer blackout to support everyone killed by police in the Philippines, and then on to the next[8] one[9].

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plea_bargain
[2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civil_forfeiture_in_the_United_States
[3] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_incarceration_rate
[4] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_rule_(attorney%27s_fees)
[5] https://www.economist.com/briefing/2020/02/20/rodrigo-dutertes-lawless-war-on-drugs-is-wildly-popular
[6] https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jul/05/philippines-senator-dela-rosa-defends-police-over-toddlers-death-in-drugs-raid
[7] https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-50236481
[8] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_killings_by_law_enforcement_officers_by_country
[9] https://worldjusticeproject.org/rule-of-law-index/", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: statement to express community solidarity
username_0: Requesting merge (to revert when appropriate) or temporary branch deployment. 

Copied/Adapted from https://www.django-rest-framework.org/ 

As requested by https://twitter.com/kwuchu/status/1267438396340932610
<issue_comment>username_1: My only concern is that (from reviewing Percy) this also takes down the Community Guidelines that is linked to from many places and feels important to be available for review.
<issue_comment>username_1: To clarify, my concern is not linking to the guidelines from the message, but ensuring the URL for the guidelines http://emberjs.com/guidelines still has them available to peruse.
<issue_comment>username_2: I am in favor of this change.

I was happy to see Ember used at the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic to quickly roll out a global tracking dashboard, and I hope Ember will similarly be used now in the pursuit of justice.  I believe this PR strikes the right balance of making a bold statement while keeping learning content available for people building applications to hold the powerful accountable.

Second, we serve an international audience and the U.S. does not have a monopoly on injustice. We should use this opportunity to start defining a set of rules for when and how we make these kinds of statements, to avoid sending the signal that only American pain matters.

But that discussion feels too academic to have right at this moment, when my Black brothers and sisters are being murdered by militarized police who are never held accountable for their actions. As small of a gesture this is, I want them to know that we are united in their struggle and that Black Lives Matter.
<issue_comment>username_3: This looks good to me.
<issue_comment>username_4: Not against the message, but I'm curious why this issue is singled out. I think you (the US) has a pretty flawed justice system[1][2][3][4] and these flaws has been known for a long time. But it's not just you. 

For example, the Philippine police has been on a fairly well-documented killing spree[5][6][7] during the past few years, in a country where police is killing about ~10x as many per year compared to the US.

Again, I'm not against open-source projects taking a stance. Though personally, I think it would be better to focus on issues closer to the software field, e.g. software patents and government efforts to weaken encryption.

Obviously there is a ton of social and economical injustices that one could get involved in. However, your flawed justice system is actually pretty functional compared to some other places. So if you want to be non-discriminatory in what causes you support, up next should be a 10x longer blackout to support everyone killed by police in the Philippines, and then on to the next[8] one[9].

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plea_bargain
[2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Civil_forfeiture_in_the_United_States
[3] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_incarceration_rate
[4] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_rule_(attorney%27s_fees)
[5] https://www.economist.com/briefing/2020/02/20/rodrigo-dutertes-lawless-war-on-drugs-is-wildly-popular
[6] https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jul/05/philippines-senator-dela-rosa-defends-police-over-toddlers-death-in-drugs-raid
[7] https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-50236481
[8] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_killings_by_law_enforcement_officers_by_country
[9] https://worldjusticeproject.org/rule-of-law-index/

automatically integrates with Slack and Mailchimp
every new registration gets added to MailChimp email list
look up members through dedicated directory
would be like LinkedIn
powered by Algolia
leaderboard from HeyTaco: https://www.heytaco.chat/api
https://www.heytaco.chat/api/v1/json/leaderboard/T0KQTUZ2B?days=365
events based on location
goals/milestones/career advice/path
Job Postings (should include speaking opportunities/conference discounts)

People cannot post to jobs automatically; they have to register through website & pay to post jobs there
URL: /jobs 
Location
San Francisco
Austin
Chicago
NYC
Los Angeles
Add chapters in as they get formed
Job Type
Full-Time
Contract
Internship
Apprenticeship
Job Role
Engineering
Marketing
etc.
Tracking
MixPanel/Google Analytics
Companies want diverse candidates applying to their roles
Pricing
Use Memberful to put pricing for certain job posts
https://memberful.com/pricing/
Aggregator
FYI: Alejandro Rincon is currently working on a web app that aggregates all the job postings for easier consumption. We would want Slack auth here.
Internal Documentation (Slab)
URL: https://techqueria.slab.com
For folks to easily contribute internal long-form documentation
Career Path
URL: https://techqueria.com/hub/career-goals 
Gamified
this gamification could be enhanced by highlight/giving props (HeyTaco) to folks that have helped you complete career milestones
Refer a friend
URL: https://techqueria.com/referrals or https://techqueria.org/refer-a-friend 
Should be public facing in case allies want to let their Latinx friends know about it
v1 Sends email to friend inviting them to sign up
OR https://communitybot.co/?ref=producthunt
Blog
URL: https://techqueria.com/blog 
Big announcements should all go on our blog and then be linked on social media, Slack, email, etc.
Email Newsletter
URL: https://techqueria.com/subscribe 
We should have link to email archive for easy reference
[Truncated]

Shop
Jobs (only shown when logged in)
Join or Login
Look Into

https://splashthat.com/
https://www.salesforce.org/nonprofit/get-started/ 
https://www.algolia.com/for-open-source/
https://launchpass.com
https://en.gravatar.com/site/implement/
https://memberful.com/pricing/
https://buffer.com/pricing
https://slab.com/features/
https://spreadshirt.com
To Set Up ASAP
Disqus Comments on Website for Blog Posts
Shared Email Inbox (MailClark)
Collaborative Team Documentation (Slab)
Social Media Automation for sharing posts across all social media platforms (Buffer)', 'title': 'Ideation: Feature List for Member Portal (WIP)', 'type': 'issue'}

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: add a menu and a link to Simplified Chinese version document
username_0: - As I mentioned before in #149, I am translating OpenTracing Documents to Simplified Chinese version . 

- I add a menu, `Other Language Documents`, to choose other languages, if there are other users to contribute translations. As default, I add a link to Simplified Chinese version document.
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 sorry for the delay here, I had a crazy week.

I was looking at what other projects have done with this sort of thing and I couldn't find any examples.

My concern is only that the Simplified Chinese version of the docs will fall out of date. Maybe you could add something to the header of the translated version that specifies the most recent update?

Thanks.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 , I changed the to `Translations`, and only add `Flag of China`. Because Enlish is the original version, only Chinese version is translations. 

At the same time, I can't find any release version of opentracing.io repository ( maybe consider to add later? ), and I have to choose to add a timestamp at the end of line.

Further, in order to keep translators like me, or any interested people, I commend to add release version, and release note.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 , are you all in KubeCon?
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1, @yurishkuro  
Is the `translation` link page good enough? or any other opinions?
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 ,  Simplified Chinese version of OT spec released. I am ready to merge to official online doc.
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 sorry for the delay -- can you post a screenshot of how the new link looks in a browser? Thanks.
<issue_comment>username_1: Actually, forget it -- just checked it out locally. LGTM, thanks!
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 , I will have a speak in my company, to introduce OT. And I have PowerPoint Document in English, can you give me a e-mail, and help me review it?
<issue_comment>username_2: I can help you with that if you like! I'm at priyanka@lightstep.com.

Best,
Priyanka 

Sent from my iPhone

>
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_2, Thanks a lot. I will send to you as soon as possible. I am writing it, it will cost more time.

Background, it's the first class of OT spec, and i am in one of top level APM company in China.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_2 , I have send you a mail from wu.sheng.841108@gmail.com and wu.sheng@foxmail.com, including a powerpoint doc in attachment.

After your review, please let me know on github. Thank you.
<issue_comment>username_2: Hi! I got your email. I'll send you a response by tomorrow morning if that's cool (it's Tuesday morning in SF right now :-)). 

Sent from my iPhone

>
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_2 thank you.
<issue_comment>username_2: Sent you a note with suggestions!
